name: Wilderness Crone
description: The Wilderness Crone embodies the essence of the natural world, exuding an aura of harmony with the flora and fauna around her.
memorable: Her ability to transform dead humanoids into beasts and her influence over animals makes her a unique presence in the wilderness.
goals: To nurture and protect her domain and communicate with the creatures of nature.
relations: Often accompanied by beasts and plants, acting as a protector or mother figure in the wild.
environment: Usually found in forests or natural settings rich in flora and fauna.
strengths: Possesses magical abilities to communicate with animals and plants; has strong spells and a unique life restoration ability.
weaknesses: Relatively low intelligence and strength limit her physical combat capabilities.
attacks: Uses a staff to deal bludgeoning and force damage, and can unleash a damaging cone of pine needles.
most_powerful_ability: Needle Breath, which deals significant piercing damage to multiple targets in a cone.
senses: Has darkvision that allows her to see in the dark up to 60 feet.
skills: Possesses a decent perception skill, allowing her to notice details in her surroundings.
additional_information: Can cast spells like 'Goodberry' and 'Hold Person'.
Her 'Beast Passivism' ability prevents low-intelligence beasts from attacking her.
Can teleport between trees using 'Tree Stride'.
Her ability to restore humanoids as beasts adds a unique twist to encounters.
spellcasting: Can cast spells at will, including 'Minor Illusion' and 'Tree Stride', and has access to powerful spells once per day.
test_queries: fey creature that talks to plants and animals
magical crone that restores life as beasts
forest-dwelling creature with needle breath attack
multitude of spells from a nature-centered fey
